blogPost.title: “It doesn't make sense to run electric cars on electric energy which is produced from fossil fuels or carbon. It just doesn't make sense.” When will electric cars rule the road? We ask @VWGroup CEO @Herbert_Diess on “The Economist Asks” podcast https://t.co/oENm2ypEJM
blogPost.author: The Economist

localize.full_text: "用化石燃料或碳产生的电能运行电动汽车是没有意义的。它只是没有意义。" 电动汽车何时才能统治道路？我们在 "经济学家问 "播客https://t.co/oENm2ypEJM，问@VWG集团CEO @Herbert_Diess。
"用化石燃料或碳產生的電能運行電動汽車是沒有意義的。它只是沒有意義。" 電動汽車何時才能統治道路？我們在 "經濟學家問 "播客https://t.co/oENm2ypEJM，問@VWG集團CEO @Herbert_Diess。

previous.title: A study of 1,500 workers in 46 countries found that 85% said their well-being had declined. People are reporting neck and back pain, too  https://t.co/Y1lp52GNc0

localize.full_text: 一项对46个国家1500名工人的研究发现，85%的人说他们的幸福感下降了。人们也在报告颈部和背部疼痛，https://t.co/Y1lp52GNc0。
一項對46個國家1500名工人的研究發現，85%的人說他們的幸福感下降了。人們也在報告頸部和背部疼痛，https://t.co/Y1lp52GNc0。

next.title: Republicans have introduced the most bills in Pennsylvania, Georgia and Arizona—the battleground states that delivered President Joe Biden his electoral-college victory https://t.co/5AP6zGJQBr

localize.full_text: 共和党人在宾夕法尼亚州、佐治亚州和亚利桑那州提出的议案最多--这些战地州为乔-拜登总统带来了选举团的胜利https://t.co/5AP6zGJQBr。
共和黨人在賓夕法尼亞州、佐治亞州和亞利桑那州提出的議案最多--這些戰地州爲喬-拜登總統帶來了選舉團的勝利https://t.co/5AP6zGJQBr。
